alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 6:57PM CDT until May 23 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR RANDALL...SOUTHEASTERN DEAF SMITH AND SOUTHERN POTTER COUNTIES... At 656 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Valley De Oro to near Mescalero Park to 6 miles southeast of Buffalo Lake, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Canyon, Lake Tanglewood, Mescalero Park, Buffalo Lake, Bushland, Dawn, Valley De Oro, Umbarger and Timbercreek Canyon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
